focus_skills: Ratios, rates, proportional relationships, and units
Systems of 2 linear equations in 2 variables
Inference from sample statistics and margin of error

questions.question: If <math><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>23</mn></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>x</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: To solve for x, first add 9 to both sides of the equation: <math><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>32</mn></math>. Then, divide both sides by 4: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Isolate the variable term first by performing inverse operations (addition/subtraction) before addressing the coefficient.

questions.question: Which expression is equivalent to <math><mn>5</mn><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>?
questions.explanation: First, apply the distributive property to <math><mn>5</mn><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></math> to get <math><mn>5</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>15</mn><mi>x</mi></math>. Then subtract <math><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>: <math><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>15</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>15</mn><mi>x</mi></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Always distribute before combining like terms. Watch out for negative signs during distribution.

questions.skill: Ratios, rates, proportional relationships, and units
questions.question: A printing machine can print 480 pages in 4 minutes. At this rate, how many pages can the machine print in 10 minutes?
questions.explanation: First, find the unit rate: <math><mfrac><mn>480</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>120</mn></math> pages per minute. Then multiply by 10 minutes: <math><mn>120</mn><mo>Ã—</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>1,200</mn></math> pages.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Calculate the unit rate (quantity per 1 unit of time) to easily scale up to any amount of time.

questions.question: A right circular cylinder has a radius of 4 units and a height of 5 units. What is the volume of the cylinder in cubic units? (Note: <math><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>π</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>h</mi></math>. Enter your answer in terms of <math><mi>π</mi></math>. For example, if the answer is <math><mn>10</mn><mi>π</mi></math>, enter 10.)
questions.explanation: Using the formula <math><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>π</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>h</mi></math>, substitute <math><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math> and <math><mi>h</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>. <math><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>π</mi><mo>(</mo><msup><mn>4</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>π</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>16</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>80</mn><mi>π</mi></math>. The question asks for the coefficient of <math><mi>π</mi></math>, which is 80.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Pay close attention to whether the question asks for an approximate value or an exact value in terms of pi.

questions.skill: Systems of 2 linear equations in 2 variables
questions.question:
The system of equations below has solution <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></math>.
<math><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>16</mn></math>
<math><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>
What is the value of <math><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Add the two equations together to eliminate y: <math><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>16</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></math>, which simplifies to <math><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn></math>. Dividing by 4 gives <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>. The question asks for <math><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></math>, so <math><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When coefficients of a variable are opposites (like +2y and -2y), adding the equations is the fastest solution method.

questions.question: A certain population of bacteria triples every 4 hours. If the initial population is 500, which function <math><mi>P</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></math> represents the population after <math><mi>t</mi></math> hours?
questions.explanation: The standard exponential growth formula is <math><mi>P</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>b</mi><msup><mo>)</mo><mfrac><mi>t</mi><mi>k</mi></mfrac></msup></math>, where <math><mi>a</mi></math> is the initial amount, <math><mi>b</mi></math> is the growth factor, and <math><mi>k</mi></math> is the time it takes to grow by that factor. Here <math><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>500</mn></math>, <math><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>, and <math><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. Thus, <math><mi>P</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>500</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mfrac><mi>t</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></msup></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Check your exponent by plugging in the 'doubling' or 'tripling' time. If t=4, the exponent should become 1.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='350' height='350' viewBox='0 0 350 350' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='350' height='350' fill='white' stroke='black'/><line x1='40' y1='310' x2='310' y2='310' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='40' y1='310' x2='40' y2='40' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><text x='150' y='340' font-family='Arial' font-size='14'>Variable X</text><text x='10' y='180' font-family='Arial' font-size='14' transform='rotate(-90 10,180)'>Variable Y</text><g stroke='black' fill='black'><circle cx='70' cy='250' r='3'/><circle cx='100' cy='220' r='3'/><circle cx='130' cy='200' r='3'/><circle cx='160' cy='170' r='3'/><circle cx='190' cy='150' r='3'/><circle cx='220' cy='130' r='3'/><circle cx='250' cy='100' r='3'/><circle cx='280' cy='80' r='3'/></g><line x1='40' y1='280' x2='310' y2='55' stroke='blue' stroke-width='2' stroke-dasharray='5,5'/><text x='35' y='325' font-size='10'>0</text><text x='89' y='325' font-size='10'>2</text><text x='143' y='325' font-size='10'>4</text><text x='197' y='325' font-size='10'>6</text><text x='251' y='325' font-size='10'>8</text><text x='305' y='325' font-size='10'>10</text><text x='25' y='310' font-size='10'>0</text><text x='20' y='242' font-size='10'>20</text><text x='20' y='175' font-size='10'>40</text><text x='20' y='108' font-size='10'>60</text><text x='20' y='40' font-size='10'>80</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Scatterplot with 8 points showing a positive linear trend. The x-axis ranges from 0 to 10 and y-axis from 0 to 80. A line of best fit passes roughly through (0, 10) and (10, 75).
questions.question: The scatterplot shows the relationship between two variables, x and y. A line of best fit is also shown. Which of the following is closest to the slope of the line of best fit?
questions.explanation: Select two points on the line of best fit to calculate the slope. The line appears to pass near <math><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo></math> and <math><mo>(</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>75</mn><mo>)</mo></math>. The slope <math><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>75</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>65</mn><mn>10</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>6.5</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When estimating slope from a graph, pick grid intersections or clear points on the line, not necessarily the data points themselves.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><line x1='50' y1='100' x2='350' y2='100' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='50' y1='200' x2='350' y2='200' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='100' y1='50' x2='300' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><text x='160' y='90' font-size='16'>110°</text><text x='230' y='230' font-size='16'>x°</text><text x='360' y='105' font-size='14'>L1</text><text x='360' y='205' font-size='14'>L2</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Two parallel horizontal lines L1 and L2 cut by a transversal line. An angle above L1 and to the left of the transversal is 110 degrees. Angle x is below L2 and to the right of the transversal.
questions.question: In the figure above, line <math><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is parallel to line <math><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. What is the value of <math><mi>x</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: The angle labeled <math><mn>110</mn><mo>°</mo></math> and angle <math><mi>x</mi></math> are alternate exterior angles. When two parallel lines are cut by a transversal, alternate exterior angles are congruent. Therefore, <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>110</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Recall that for parallel lines, alternate interior, alternate exterior, and corresponding angles are equal.

questions.question: Which expression is equivalent to <math><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></math>?
questions.explanation: Find a common denominator: <math><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac></math>. Expand numerators: <math><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></math>. Combine like terms: <math><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></math>. The result is <math><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When adding rational expressions, always establish a common denominator first, then combine the numerators.

questions.question: A linear function passes through the points <math><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo></math> and <math><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>17</mn><mo>)</mo></math>. What is the slope of the graph of this function?
questions.explanation: Slope formula <math><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></math>. Substitute the points: <math><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>17</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>9</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Remember 'rise over run': the change in y divided by the change in x.

questions.question: A bakery sells muffins for $3 each and croissants for $4 each. The bakery wants to earn at least $500 per day but can bake no more than 150 items total. If <math><mi>m</mi></math> represents the number of muffins and <math><mi>c</mi></math> represents the number of croissants, which system of inequalities represents this situation?
questions.explanation: The total number of items is <math><mi>m</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi></math>, which must be 'no more than 150', so <math><mi>m</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>150</mn></math>. The revenue is <math><mn>3</mn><mi>m</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>c</mi></math>, which must be 'at least 500', so <math><mn>3</mn><mi>m</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>c</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>500</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Translate key phrases directly: 'no more than' means <math><mo>≤</mo></math>, and 'at least' means <math><mo>≥</mo></math>.

questions.question: The equation <math><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> has exactly one real solution. What is the value of the constant <math><mi>c</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: For a quadratic equation to have exactly one real solution, the discriminant (<math><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>a</mi><mi>c</mi></math>) must equal 0. Here <math><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math> and <math><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn></math>. <math><mo>(</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> -> <math><mn>36</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> -> <math><mn>36</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>c</mi></math> -> <math><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4.5</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: The discriminant determines the solution count: positive = 2 real, zero = 1 real, negative = 0 real.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='200' viewBox='0 0 400 200' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect x='50' y='50' width='300' height='100' fill='none' stroke='black'/><line x1='50' y1='100' x2='350' y2='100' stroke='black'/><line x1='150' y1='50' x2='150' y2='150' stroke='black'/><line x1='250' y1='50' x2='250' y2='150' stroke='black'/><text x='100' y='80' font-size='14' text-anchor='middle'>Group A</text><text x='200' y='80' font-size='14' text-anchor='middle'>Group B</text><text x='300' y='80' font-size='14' text-anchor='middle'>Total</text><text x='100' y='130' font-size='14' text-anchor='middle'>15</text><text x='200' y='130' font-size='14' text-anchor='middle'>35</text><text x='300' y='130' font-size='14' text-anchor='middle'>50</text><text x='15' y='130' font-size='14'>Passed</text><text x='200' y='30' font-size='16' text-anchor='middle'>Exam Results</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A table showing exam results for Group A and Group B. Row 'Passed': Group A has 15, Group B has 35, Total is 50. Row 'Failed' (implied but not explicit in partial SVG, problem text supplies total context): Group A has 25, Group B has 25. Total students = 100.
questions.question: A total of 100 students took an exam. 40 students were in Group A and 60 were in Group B. In Group A, 15 students passed. In Group B, 35 students passed. If a student is selected at random from those who passed, what is the probability that the student was in Group B?
questions.explanation: Total passed = <math><mn>15</mn><mo>(</mo><mtext>Group A</mtext><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>35</mn><mo>(</mo><mtext>Group B</mtext><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>50</mn></math>. The condition is 'selected from those who passed'. Out of these 50, 35 are from Group B. Probability = <math><mfrac><mn>35</mn><mn>50</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.70</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For conditional probability, restrict your denominator to the group defined by the 'given' condition.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='300' height='200' viewBox='0 0 300 200' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><polygon points='50,150 250,150 250,50' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><text x='40' y='165' font-size='14'>A</text><text x='255' y='165' font-size='14'>C</text><text x='255' y='45' font-size='14'>B</text><rect x='230' y='130' width='20' height='20' fill='none' stroke='black'/><text x='150' y='170' font-size='14'>24</text><text x='260' y='100' font-size='14'>7</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Right triangle ABC with right angle at C. Side AC = 24, side BC = 7.
questions.question: In right triangle <math><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi></math> shown above, what is the value of <math><mi>sin</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>)</mo></math>?
questions.explanation: Use the Pythagorean theorem to find the hypotenuse <math><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi></math>: <math><msup><mn>7</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mn>24</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>c</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> -> <math><mn>49</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>576</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>625</mn></math> -> <math><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn></math>. <math><mi>sin</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mtext>Opposite</mtext><mtext>Hypotenuse</mtext></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>7</mn><mn>25</mn></mfrac></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Recognize Pythagorean triples like 7-24-25, 3-4-5, and 5-12-13 to save calculation time.

questions.question: The expression <math><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>16</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></math> is equivalent to which of the following?
questions.explanation: Use polynomial division or algebraic rewriting. <math><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>16</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Try to construct the denominator within the numerator to split the fraction easily.

questions.question:
If <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></math> is the solution to the system of equations below and <math><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>x</mi></math>? (If there is more than one solution, provide the larger value.)
<math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn></math>
<math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math>
questions.explanation: Set the equations equal: <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math>. Rearrange to <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Factor: <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. The solutions are <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math> and <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. Both are greater than 0. The question asks for the larger value, which is 4.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When equating a quadratic and linear function, rearrange into standard quadratic form equal to zero and factor.

questions.skill: Inference from sample statistics and margin of error
questions.question: A researcher estimates that 45% of a city's residents support a new law, with a margin of error of 3% at a 95% confidence level. Which of the following is the most appropriate conclusion?

options.A: Exactly 45% of residents support the law.
options.B: We are 95% confident that the true percentage of supporters is between 42% and 48%.
options.C: We are 95% confident that exactly 45% of residents support the law.
options.D: At least 48% of residents likely support the law.

questions.explanation: The margin of error creates an interval around the point estimate. <math><mn>45</mn><mo>%</mo><mo>±</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>%</mo></math> yields the interval <math><mo>[</mo><mn>42</mn><mo>%</mo><mo>,</mo><mn>48</mn><mo>%</mo><mo>]</mo></math>. The confidence level describes the certainty that the true population parameter lies within this interval.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Margin of error defines a range, not an exact value. It implies plausibility for the population parameter, not certainty.

questions.question: The equation of a circle in the xy-plane is <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>11</mn></math>. What is the radius of the circle?
questions.explanation: Complete the square for x and y. <math><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>11</mn></math>. Add <math><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn></math> and <math><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>8</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>16</mn></math> to both sides. <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>11</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>16</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>36</mn></math>. Since <math><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>36</mn></math>, the radius <math><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: To complete the square for <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi></math>, always add <math><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mi>b</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup></math>.

questions.question: In the equation <math><mi>k</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn></math>, <math><mi>k</mi></math> is a constant. If the equation has no solution, what is the value of <math><mi>k</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Distribute k: <math><mi>k</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn></math>. For a linear equation to have no solution, the coefficients of x must be equal, but the constant terms must be different. Setting coefficients equal: <math><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. Checking constants: <math><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>12</mn></math>, which is not equal to 12. Thus, when <math><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>, there is no solution.
questions.score_improvement_tip: No solution implies parallel lines (same slope/coefficient, different intercept/constant).

questions.question: If <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn></math> and <math><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>x</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: To solve for x, raise both sides to the reciprocal power <math><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>. <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>9</mn><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></msup></math>. This is equivalent to <math><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mn>9</mn></msqrt><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>3</mn><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>27</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When solving rational exponents, calculate the root first (denominator) then the power (numerator) to keep numbers smaller.
